required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brad Arrhythmia Induced by Repeated Succinylcholine During Gynecological Laparoscopic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Brad Arrhythmia Induced by Repeated Succinylcholine by Atropine Sulfate During Gynecological Laparoscopic Surgery: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Cardiac arrhythmias are a well-recognized complication of anesthesia for laparoscopy. The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy of atropine sulfate for prevention of brad arrhythmia induced by repeated succinylcholine during gynecological laparoscopic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: 120 candidates, ASA 1 in the age range 18-40 years scheduled for elective diagnostic gynecological laparoscopic surgery were randomly assigned into 4 groups to receive either atropine sulfate or normal saline solution (as placebo).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 2 hours during surgery
primary_outcome.description: heart rate less than 60 per minutes or decrease more than 30% of baseline reading

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 4 hours during surgery
secondary_outcome.description: suction of Nasopharyngeal secretion (ml) during and after extubation

arm_group.description: Intramuscular (IM) atropine (0.01 mg/kg) (1 ml) 30 minutes before induction of anesthesia, IV normal saline 10 ml 3 minutes before induction of anesthesia and normal saline mixed with second dose succinylcholine (1mg/kg) in 5 ml syringe with normal saline

1 ml normal saline IM 30 minutes before induction of anesthesia, intravenously (IV) atropine (0.01 mg/kg) in 10 ml 3 minutes before induction of anesthesia and normal saline mixed with second dose succinylcholine (1mg/kg) in 5 ml syringe with normal saline

IM normal saline 1 ml normal 30 minutes before induction of anesthesia, IV normal saline 10 ml 3 minutes before induction of anesthesia and 1mg/kg atropine mixed with second dose succinylcholine (1mg/kg) in 5 ml syringe with normal saline

IM normal saline 1 ml normal 30 minutes before induction of anesthesia, IV normal saline 10 ml 3 minutes before induction of anesthesia and normal saline mixed with second dose succinylcholine (1mg/kg) in 5 ml syringe with normal saline

intervention.description: Atropine (0.01 mg/kg) (1 ml) IM 30 minutes before induction of anesthesia
Atropine (0.01 mg/kg) intravenously (10 ml) 3 minutes before induction of anesthesia

intervention.intervention_name: Atropine mixed with second dose succinylcholine
intervention.description: Atropine (0.01 mg/kg) added to the second dose succinylcholine (1mg/kg) prepared to 5 ml syringe with normal saline
1 ml normal saline IM 30 minutes before induction of anesthesia
IV 10 ml normal saline 3 minutes before induction of anesthesia

intervention.intervention_name: Normal saline mixed with second dose succinylcholine
intervention.description: Second dose succinylcholine (1 mg/kg) prepared to 5 ml syringe with normal saline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients 18-50 years scheduled for elective diagnostic gynecological laparoscopic surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac
- Diabetes Mellitus
- Thyroid disease
- Any endocrine disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor (Anesthesiology and Critical Care)- College of Medicine-Assiut University
